text:
Muhammad Afzal Ahsan Randhawa (, 1 September 1937 – 18 September 2017) was a Pakistani Punjabi language writer, poet, translator, playwright and a politician. He authored several short stories and novels in the Punjabi language including "Sooraj Grehan" and "Doaba". He received the Pride of Performance and "Kamal-e-Fun" awards for his literary work.
On the evening of 18 September 2017, Randhawa died at the age of 80 in Faisalabad, Pakistan.
